fields.description:
I am currently unable to run euca-describe-volumes as a non-admin user. The eucalyptus/admin is able to however:

{noformat}
[root@g-12-03 images]# time euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME  vol-a2651047    2       snap-9f20928a   two     deleting        2014-05-10T04:56:11.641Z        standard
VOLUME  vol-d4b96dab    1               two     available       2014-05-08T07:43:57.007Z        standard
VOLUME  vol-3f3c9997    1               one     available       2014-05-08T07:43:54.730Z        standard
VOLUME  vol-011ad642    2       snap-9f20928a   two     deleting        2014-05-10T04:56:12.070Z        standard
VOLUME  vol-eafbb630    2               two     available       2014-05-10T04:50:09.823Z        standard
VOLUME  vol-d5501ebd    2       snap-feaaf20e   two     deleting        2014-05-10T04:47:51.748Z        standard
VOLUME  vol-590cf726    2               two     available       2014-05-10T04:41:10.065Z        standard
VOLUME  vol-7468f3aa    2               one     available       2014-05-12T17:13:16.481Z        standard

^CTraceback (most recent call last):

    result = cmd.main()

    response = self.send()

    auth=self.auth)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 158, in send_request
    time.sleep(delay)
KeyboardInterrupt

fields.summary: Describe volumes is slow for non admins

comments.body: After stopping the churn on EBS things appear to have quiesced and are returning as expected. Trying to reproduce now.
After adding back EBS churn (5 threads) and launching 100 instance store instances the problem was reproduced.
I rebuilt the system from scratch and was able to reproduce once again.

Easiest way to reproduce:

1) Create 10 volumes
2) Run 100 instances
3) Check describe-volumes response time

The following two trials are before and after step 2:
{noformat}
[root@g-12-03 images]# time euca-describe-volumes | grep VOL | wc -l
10

real    0m5.342s
user    0m0.225s
sys     0m0.062s
[root@g-12-03 images]# time euca-describe-volumes | grep VOL | wc -l
10

real    0m45.887s
user    0m0.195s
sys     0m0.049s
[root@g-12-03 images]#
{noformat}
After more trials, the time varies widely from 5s to 55s. Im not able to identify any commonality between the ones that take >30s.

After running all night with instance-store and ebs churn it appears that the system is responding consistently within 15s. Lowering priority for now. Will bump up if i find a more easily reproducible and consistent test.
One way to reproduce long describe-volumes delay is to create many # of ebs instances. When I had about 30 ebs instances, it consistently takes 12-25 seconds.
With about 50 ebs instances, I see 46, 45, 51 seconds.
With about 70 ebs instances, I see 53, 54, and timeout at 1 minute.
It appears the latency is based on # of volumes. After terminating all instances, I created 70 volumes. Describing them takes consistently about 45-50 seconds.
The problem manifests severely for only non-eucalyptus account. For eucalyptus account, describing 78 volumes take consistently around 12 seconds. At one instance, it took 22 seconds.
Just a heads up that this may be causing 502 bad gateway errors on the console.  Should be escalated to blocker IMO.  See GUI-981
[~viglesias] Perfect, thank you!  [~dkavanagh] will spin up a new dev cloud to confirm if this was indeed the cause of GUI-981
No longer seeing the extreme slowness that was previously being hit with large number of volumes and churn.
